page.title: 08Oldest Woman in Bisbrooke
page.content: (Interview by Colan Bartram and Mark Ferguson) Mrs Webster is the oldest woman in Bisbrooke - she is 83. She came to the village in 1946 and before that lived in Uppingham for 18 months. Her home is Glasgow, and she goes back there for holidays. Mrs Webster has a small cottage with a living room, a kitchen and two bedrooms. She lives alone and her nearest relative is her aunt of 93 in Uppingham. She watches comedy, soap operas and old westerns on T.V. She gets the news from radio and T.V. and does not take a newspaper. She thinks Bisbrooke is a lovely village because it is so peaceful. She used to work in a shop and sold flowers.
